title: Development Quality Assurance Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here atVolocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft -eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis and othereVTOLsoff the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. Our aim is to offer affordable, on-demand air taxi services that fly people to their destination quickly and safely. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever piloted flight of a fully electric multicopterand have since conducted more than 1,500 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Join our team and take on a dynamic role where you'll lead Development Assurance Activities in line with DevQA processes. You'll guide our Development Team on System, Software, and Hardware topics while overseeing supplier activities in these areas. Craft comprehensive Development Assurance Plans, procedures, work instructions, and tools. Engage with Certification Authorities to ensure alignment on Development Assurance matters. Share your expertise by mentoring and training fellow engineers on related topics. As an Airworthiness Engineer, you'll develop Certification Plans for Design Assurance; as a CVE, you'll conduct thorough Design Assurance Audits both internally and at suppliers.

Your Tasks:


 * You will perform Development Assurance Activities according to the DevQA processes.
 * You will mentor the Development Team on System, Software, and Hardware topics.
 * You will monitor supplier activities related to System, Software, and Hardware.
 * You will define Development Assurance Plans, procedures, work instructions, and tools.
 * You will communicate and align with Certification Authorities on Development Assurance topics.
 * You will mentor and train other engineers on Development Assurance topics and DevQA processes.
 * (When acting as an Airworthiness Engineer) You will create Certification Plans related to Design Assurance topics.
 * (When acting as a CVE) You will execute Design Assurance Audits internally and at suppliers.
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Aeronautical Engineering, or a related field.
 * Minimum of 7years of professional experience working with DO-178B/C and/or ARP 4754(A) and/or DO-254 standards.
 * At least 5 years of experience in Quality Assurance roles.
 * Strong communication, negotiation, and auditing skills.
 * Business fluency in English; proficiency in other languages such as German is advantageous.
 * Demonstrates initiative by showing curiosity, asking probing questions, challenging the status quo to make informed decisions while managing and driving change; exhibits passion for improvement and change.
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: Junior QA Engineer
companyName: Zero to One Search | Recruitment Agency
description:
Location: Munich, Germany (on-site)




Level: Junior




The hiring company is one of Germany's largest comparison websites, offering services in areas like insurance, finance, telecommunications, and travel. The Hiring Team specifically focuses on providing users with an easy way to compare internet and telecommunications providers, packages, and pricing. They work closely with major German ISPs to offer the latest deals, speed options, and promotions. The team's goal is to streamline the selection process, enabling customers to make informed decisions based on factors like speed, price, and contract flexibility.




Join one of their teams and help them to build and grow innovative applications.







Responsibilities




 * Collaborate effectively: You will work closely with the development team and product management to establish QA standards and derive test cases
 * Take ownership: You will be responsible for developing automated tests, including their planning, specification, documentation, and execution
 * Enhance products: You will support the maintenance of the infrastructure required to run the automated tests
 * Ensure and measure quality: You will continuously improve the test environment for company applications and services




Qualifications




Must have:

 * Strong understanding of software testing methodologies, tools, and processes
 * Proficiency in developing and executing test plans, test cases, and test scripts
 * Experience with manual and automated testing techniques
 * Proficiency in JavaScript and familiarity with the Cypress testing framework
 * Strong attention to detail, analytical thinking, and problem-solving skills
 * Proficiency in written and spoken English
 * Excellent communication and teamwork abilities to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
 * Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple tasks and deadlines




Nice to have:

 * Knowledge of PHP and TypeScript
 * Proficiency in written and spoken German




Benefits




 * They will help you to progress: They offer you an extremely steep learning curve and support your development through personal coaching and individualised professional and personal training opportunities
 * They value your commitment: Permanent contract with an attractive and performance-orientated salary package including an annual bonus. Germany ticket or subsidised company bike leasing, vouchers for numerous company products and a subsidised company pension scheme on top
 * Modern working: Up to 46 days paid holiday. You receive 28 days' holiday and you can also choose between working from home on Fridays or up to 18 additional days' holiday. You can also adapt your working time model to your individual needs at any time
 * Ownership for your topics: Independent, flexible work in small teams with a strong team spirit. Short decision-making processes and short release cycles are a matter of course for the company
 * You can feel comfortable here: Free daily lunch, well-stocked drinks fridges as well as fruit, cereals and snacks. A friendly and collegial working environment. Modern office on the Donnersbergerbrücke with excellent public transport connections directly on the Munich main line
 * They are also a great team besides work: Numerous events for celebrating and networking as well as summer and Christmas parties

title: Software QA Engineer, Frankfurt; up to €80,000 p.a.
description:

In addition to a competitive salary of up to €80,000 p.a., you will enjoy flexible working arrangements, modern workspaces, company pension and health insurance plans, and a range of personal and professional development opportunities.




Are you ready to take the next step in your career? We look forward to receiving your application. Please reach out to Teresa Ries at tries@optimussearch.com or +49 (0)30166362307 with any questions.

title: Test Engineer (m/f/d) - Berlin, Germany
description:
Dentsply Sirona is the world’s largest manufacturer of professional dental products and technologies, with a 130-year history of innovation and service to the dental industry and patients worldwide. Dentsply Sirona develops, manufactures, and markets a comprehensive solutions offering including dental and oral health products as well as other consumable medical devices under a strong portfolio of world class brands. Dentsply Sirona’s products provide innovative, high-quality and effective solutions to advance patient care and deliver better and safer dentistry. Dentsply Sirona’s global headquarters is located in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA. The company’s shares are listed in the United States on NASDAQ under the symbol XRAY.




Bringing out the best in people




As advanced as dentistry is today, we are dedicated to making it even better. Our people have a passion for innovation and are committed to applying it to improve dental care. We live and breathe high performance, working as one global team, bringing out the best in each other for the benefit of dental patients, and the professionals who serve them. If you want to grow and develop as a part of a team that is shaping an industry, then we’re looking for the best to join us.




Working at Dentsply Sirona you are able to:




Develop faster - with our commitment to the best professional development.




Perform better - as part of a high-performance, empowering culture.




Shape an industry - with a market leader that continues to drive innovation.




Make a difference -by helping improve oral health worldwide.







Test Engineer (m/f/d) - Berlin, Germany




We are looking for a qualified Software Test Manager (m/f/d) with experience or a strong interest in developing expertise in test automation. As a SureSmile Test Manager (m/f/d) you will be responsible for the end-to-end software verification process: from the analysis of new software requirements, defining test strategy, plan and execute software verification till the update of the SureSmile medical device documentation.




Your Responsibilities:







 * Assist the PO in analyzing and translating orthodontic software requirements into design specifications.
 * Lead the definition of test scenarios and test cases. Update and extend the test strategy when needed.
 * Extend and update the medical device product documentation to ensure full test coverage and traceability.
 * Perform integration, functional, system and regression testing.
 * Structure, design and perform automated tests. Identify new opportunities to streamline the test methodology.
 * Collaborate closely across the various departments: R&D, Supply Chain, Training, Customer Care, QA/RA.
 * Troubleshoot with incoming operational issues.
 * Identify, document, track defects till resolved and deployed.
 * Communicate solutions and fixes to other departments/customers.







Your Profile:




 * 3+ years SW quality assurance/testing experience.
 * Experience in the orthodontic domain is advantageous.
 * Experience with working in the highly regulated medical device industry is advantageous.




Key Skills, Knowledge & Capabilities:

 * Experience with test management tools and processes (e.g. Matrix Req. X-Rays) .
 * Experience with bug/issues tracking tools (e.g. Jira) .
 * Experience in writing software tests, good understanding of software testing concepts (for example: TDD, BDD, testing pyramid)
 * Experience with the Java/Selenium and Postman API automated testing framework or other test frameworks is an advantage
 * Experience in SQL/database and scripting.
 * Great attestation to detail, critical thinking and analytical skills.
 * Strong commitment to deliver high-quality results
 * High motivation to learn and apply modern technology
 * Strong communications skills
 * Very good knowledge of English, both written and spoken. German advantageous.

title: Test Engineer
description:
Fuel Cell test engineer at Dinex Group




Dinex Group, a leading supplier of exhaust and emission systems, is looking for a skilled and committed person to join our Fuel cell team. This position offers a unique opportunity to work closely with our engineering and research teams on energy conversion test equipment: build-up, optimization of test benches and testing of MEA’s.




Position will report to CCM-Fuel cell R&D lead in Dinex’s Germany and will work at our location in Bayreuth, Germany.




CCM-Fuel cell team at Dinex

CCM-Fuel cell in Dinex is a fast-growing R&D team which covers catalyst, ink development, coating of CCMs and fuel cell testing, for heavy duty applications.




Qualifications

At Dinex, we promote diversity and inclusion, and we focus only on the qualifications below when we review applications:




 * Experience in working with Fuel cell test benches




 * Master’s degree in Materials Science or Process Engineering or Electrochemical engineering.




 * Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail and enthusiasm for hands-on work in a research and development setting




 * Effective communication skills and the ability to work in a collaborative team environment.




 * Fluent in oral and written English, Basic German




Roles & Responsibilities




 * Preparation of membrane electrolyte assembly (MEAs)




 * Quality testing of catalyst coated substrates and membranes during development
 * 
 * Quality testing of full scale CCMs for heavy duty applications
 * 
 * Development of testing techniques together with other researchers
 * 
 * Generate detailed reports and documentation of results and findings.
 * 
 * Responsible for the proper functioning of the testing equipment and maintenance




Career Perspectives




For the right applicant we offer a challenging and rewarding research and development position, which will put your skills to the test. Additionally, growth in competencies, personality, and a career opportunity nationally as well as globally.




With the right attitude, potential and willingness, you will experience Dinex as a company with strong values and high professionalism. Last but not least, we see an attractive future ahead of us, and you will be part of a company that is at the forefront of the sustainability agenda.




Interested:




We are looking for someone who can join us as soon as possible, so please apply soon! In case you have any questions, feel free to contact Dr. Rameshwori L. Jalan, CCM Development, at jar@dinex.de or +491602937725.

title: Test Engineer
description:
Job Title: Test Engineer (m/f/d)

Location: Berlin, Germany

Remote Work: Up to 60%

Start Date: Immediate or as agreed

Annual Salary: Up to €90,000

Must be fluent in German for this position




About the Role:

We are hiring a skilled Test Engineer to join our client Bundesdruckerei in Berlin. In this role, you will be responsible for driving test planning, execution, and automation strategies within a dynamic and agile development environment. Your expertise will play a key part in ensuring software quality through innovative testing solutions and collaboration with cross-functional teams.




Key Responsibilities:

 * Plan, manage, and execute comprehensive testing strategies, including automated testing.
 * Collaborate with development teams to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve issues quickly while supporting manual testing when needed.
 * Develop test code and glue code for BDD testing and automation frameworks.
 * Report test results, enhance existing test cases, and optimize workflows for better efficiency.
 * Create detailed documentation to facilitate the identification and reproduction of errors and issues.
 * Integrate test tools into workflows, prepare test data, and set up mocking systems as required.
 * Perform acceptance tests during sprints and regression tests at sprint closures.




Your Profile:

 * A degree in Computer Science or a related field, with solid experience in functional, API, performance, and usability testing.
 * Proficiency in unit and infrastructure testing within containerized environments.
 * Strong understanding of microservices testing in complex architectures with CI/CD pipelines (e.g., GitLab Pipelines, Jenkins) and a basic grasp of DevOps activities.
 * Hands-on expertise in test automation frameworks (frontend and backend), such as Karma, Selenium, Jest, and Cypress.
 * Familiarity with programming languages for end-to-end testing and BDD tools, such as Gherkin.
 * Experience managing tests in Agile/Scrum projects using tools like Jira and Confluence.
 * Solid background in component, acceptance, integration, load, and stress testing, as well as debugging and performance analysis using tools like Postman or SoapUI.




Framework Conditions:

 * Location: Berlin, with up to 60% remote work flexibility.
 * Start Date: Immediately or based on availability.
 * Annual Salary: Up to €90,000.




Why Join?

This is a fantastic opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects, contribute to quality assurance in a fast-paced, agile environment, and make a significant impact within a high-performing team.

If you have a passion for software testing, automation, and collaboration, we would love to hear from you!

title: Manual Tester- (Playtime Supply) (f/m/d) (copy)
description:
adjoe is a leading mobile ad platform developing cutting-edge advertising and monetization solutions that take its app partners’ business to the next level. Part of the applike group ecosystem, adjoe is home to an advanced tech stack, powerful financial backing from Bertelsmann, and a highly motivated workforce to be reckoned with.

Meet Your Team: Playtime Supply

Playtime Supply is building a unique software solution for app and game developers that puts users’ needs first. Instead of traditional monetization mechanisms, Playtime builds an engaging ad experience in which users can play and earn rewards for various new mobile games in Playtime. To predict which mobile game will best suit a user, the team has introduced ML algorithms.

To build this rewarded experience, adjoe’s backend reliably handles more than 200 million users – remaining stable despite impressive growth in the user base. And imagine this: adjoe’s Golang event consumer applications assign rewards equivalent to 700 months’ of time spent in Playtime every day to its users.

The software depends on two main components.1) adjoe’s Android mobile SDK – written in a combination of Java and Kotlin – which can be bundled by developers in their apps. 2) The team’s highly scalable Golang backend, which is hosted on AWS and is otherwise responsible for developing a modern React (TypeScript) dashboard that provides adjoe’s clients and Business team colleagues with fast-loading insights.

What You Will Do


 * Work in cross-functional teams to achieve the highest level of quality across the software development lifecycle.
 * Collaborate with adjoe’s Product Leads to develop and execute comprehensive test strategies and plans.
 * Conduct manual test cases and analyze results to ensure our SDKs, web apps, dashboards, and APIs are working correctly.
 * Play a key role in reporting and troubleshooting any bugs or errors that may occur.
 * Take ownership of post-release and post-implementation testing.
 * Propose new testing scenarios & work on increasing auto-test coverage
 * Be part of an international English-speaking team dedicated to scaling our adtech platform beyond our hundreds of millions of monthly active users.
   
   
   

Who You Are


 * You have 2+ years of experience as a Manual Tester or similar.
 * You are experienced in QA methodology.
 * You are familiar with Agile frameworks and regression/smoke/LIT testing.
 * You are able to document and troubleshoot errors.
 * You have a working knowledge of test management software (e.g. qTest, Cypress, Zephyr) and SQL.
 * You have hands-on experience with Automation Testing Tools (e.g. Appium, Selenium or Playwright).
 * You have excellent communication skills.
 * You pay attention to detail.
 * You have an analytical mind and problem-solving attitude.
 * You have strong organizational skills.
 * Plus: You have experience with (mobile) games QA
   
   
   

Have You Heard of Our Perks?


 * Work-Life Package: 2 remote days per week, 30 vacation days, 3 weeks per year of remote work, flexible working hours, dog-friendly kick-ass office in the center of the city.
 * Relocation Package: Visa & legal support, relocation bonus, reimbursement of German Classes costs, and more.
 * Happy Belly Package: Monthly company lunch, tons of free snacks and drinks, free breakfast & fresh delicious pastries every Monday
 * Physical & Mental Health Package: In-house gym with a personal trainer, various classes like Yoga with expert teachers & free of charge access to our EAP (Employee Assistance Program) to support your mental health and well-being
 * Activity Package: Regular team and company events, and hackathons.
 * Education Package: Opportunities to boost your professional development with courses and training directly connected to your career goals
 * Wealth building: virtual stock options for all our regular employees
   
   
   

Skip writing cover letters. Tell us about your most passionate personal project, your desired salary and your earliest possible start date. We are looking forward to your application!

We welcome applications from people who will contribute to the diversity of our company.

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about ensuring the quality and reliability of cutting-edge software solutions? Join an organization leading the way in secure IT systems and digital identity innovation. This 18-month contract offers you the chance to play a key role in advancing secure, high-performance systems that make a real-world impact.




About the Organization

This role is with a prestigious, government-owned enterprise specializing in developing secure IT systems and digital solutions for identity management. Renowned for innovation, the organization delivers trusted services that safeguard sensitive data and enable efficient digital operations across the public and private sectors.

With a mission to protect digital sovereignty, their projects involve complex architectures, microservices, and advanced automation, ensuring the highest standards of reliability and security.




Why This Role?

 * Make an Impact: Be a driving force in ensuring the quality and reliability of critical digital systems.
 * Cutting-Edge Tools: Work with advanced testing frameworks, automation tools, and CI/CD pipelines.
 * Flexibility and Work-Life Balance: Enjoy up to 75% remote work while collaborating with a highly skilled team.
 * Attractive Compensation: Earn up to €90,000 annually with the stability of an 18-month contract.




Your Responsibilities

As a Test Engineer, you’ll be instrumental in ensuring the delivery of high-quality, secure software solutions. Your role includes:

 * Developing and driving strategies for automated testing and test execution.
 * Collaborating closely with the development team to troubleshoot and resolve issues.
 * Writing and maintaining test code for behavior-driven testing (BDD) and test automation.
 * Managing and documenting test cases for functionality, APIs, performance, integration, and usability.
 * Performing acceptance tests during sprints and regression tests at sprint closures.
 * Preparing test data and setting up mocking systems as needed.
 * Integrating test tools into workflows and continuously improving testing processes.




Your Profile

To succeed in this role, you should bring:

 * A degree in Computer Science or a related field.
 * Strong experience in designing and documenting test cases for complex systems.
 * Expertise in unit testing, infrastructure testing, and microservices testing in CI/CD environments (e.g., GitLab Pipelines, Jenkins).
 * Hands-on experience with test automation tools like Selenium, Jest, Karma, Cypress, and Postman.
 * Proficiency in programming languages for testing, such as Gherkin, and experience with behavior-driven testing frameworks.
 * Familiarity with tools like Jira and Confluence for test management in agile projects.
 * Knowledge of load and stress testing, debugging, and performance measurements.




Framework Conditions

 * Location: Berlin-based, with up to 75% remote work.
 * Start Date: Immediate or as agreed.
 * Duration: 18 months under the ANU framework.
 * Salary: Up to €90,000 annually.




Join the Team and Shape the Future

Take the opportunity to work on critical projects that protect and empower digital identities. Collaborate with a team of experts, leverage the latest tools, and make a meaningful impact in a secure and innovative environment.




Apply now and contribute to the future of digital security! For any questions or additional details, feel free to get in touch.

title: Agile Test Engineer Public (m/w/d)
description:
Stellenbeschreibung

Als führende, weltweit agierende IT-Beratung begleitet uns das Thema Digitalisierung seit Jahren intensiv bei unseren Kunden, Projekten und Services. Eine besondere Rolle wird dabei dem öffentlichen Sektor zuteil. Wie in kaum einem anderen Bereich kommen hier ein hoher Bedarf an Innovationen, Verbesserungen und Unterstützungsbedarfen mit einer sehr stabilen Finanzierungssituation und Struktur zusammen.

Im Rahmen dieser Stelle arbeiten Sie als Trusted Advisor mit unseren Kunden auf Augenhöhe. Durch unseren klaren Fokus auf große Kunden (und für diese Stelle insbesondere im Rhein-Main-Gebiet) sind Sie zumeist als Mitglied eines CGI Teams tätig. Am Standort Eschborn werden Sie Teil von ca. 120 weiteren, im öffentlichen Sektor tätigen, Kolleginnen und Kollegen. Ein modernes und flexibles Arbeitsumfeld ist für Sie bei CGI sowohl beim Einsatz beim Kunden vor Ort, in unseren Büro-Räumen, wie auch im Home Office selbstverständlich.

Als Agile Test Engineer (m/w/d) bringen Sie Ihre Erfahrungen in den Digitalisierungsprojekten unserer Kunden ein und tragen dazu bei, diese mit hoher Qualität zum Erfolg zu führen. Sie stellen sicher, dass die vereinbarten Projektziele in Zeit, Qualität und Budget erreicht werden und die Vorteile der Digitalisierung im Kundenumfeld qualitativ hochwertig zum Tragen kommen. Da sich unsere Kunden zum größten Teil noch im Umbruch hin zu agilen Liefermethoden befinden, ist Ihre Erfahrung mit solchen Methoden besonders gefragt.

Neben dem Einsatz beim Kunden vor Ort entwickeln Sie sich bei CGI in einem transparenten und fairen Karrieremodell. Dazu gehören individuelle Entwicklungspläne sowie jährliche persönliche Entwicklungsziele. Bei CGI gibt es kein „up or out“, sondern einen starken Fokus auf die individuelle Lebenssituation und wie diese langfristig mit einer Karriere bei CGI verbunden werden kann. Der Wiedereinstieg ins Unternehmen nach einer Elternzeit ist bei uns ebenso selbstverständlich wie die Möglichkeit ein Sabbatical einzulegen.

Aufgaben

Unsere Kunden sehen uns als Berater:innen und Expert:innen, die sie bei der Lösung ihrer Probleme individuell und effektiv unterstützen. Als Agile Test Engineer (m/w/d) übernehmen Sie hier eine wichtige Rolle im Kontext der Digitalisierung und bringen ihre Expertise in die Testprojekte mit ein.

Je nach Projektsituation umfasst dies die folgenden Aufgaben und Tätigkeiten:


 * Ausführen und Protokollieren von manuellen und automatisierten Tests
 * Erstellung von Reportings aller Testergebnisse
 * Review und Detaillierung von internen Anforderungen und des Kunden
 * Erstellen, Review und Detaillieren von komplexen Testfällen
 * Einbringen von Verbesserungsvorschlägen zur kontinuierlichen Qualitätsverbesserung
   
   

Als kreative:r Leistungsträger:in unterstützen Sie nicht nur im Rahmen von Projekten, sondern bringen Ihre Erfahrungen und Ideen auch innerhalb von CGI durch die Mitarbeit am Ausbau unserer Practices in den Themen Test & Quality Services ein.

Die massiven Herausforderungen der Digitalisierung, insbesondere im öffentlichen Sektor, bieten aus Beratungssicht außergewöhnliche Karrierechancen und ermöglichen spannende Optionen zur persönlichen und fachlichen Entwicklung. Wir freuen uns darauf, mit Ihnen gemeinsam die Bedürfnisse von Bürger:innen, Angestellten und Beamt:innen zu verstehen und diesen mit nachhaltigen, digitalen Lösungen zu begegnen.

Qualifikation

Sie haben ein Studium mit informationstechnischem oder wirtschaftswissenschaftlichem Schwerpunkt (beispielsweise Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftsmathematik) oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung abgeschlossen und bereits mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Software Testing. Dazu bringen Sie folgende Kenntnisse und Fähigkeiten mit:


 * Mind. 2-3 Jahre Erfahrung als Tester:in / Testingenieur:in in agilen Projekten (SCRUM, LESS, SAFe etc)
 * Praktische Erfahrung mit Ansätzen wie „Testing First“
 * Kenntnisse der marktüblichen Testtools und Frameworks
 * Praktische Erfahrung Testautomation im Rahmen von CI/CD
 * Allgemeine Programmiererfahrung einer Skript-/Programmiersprache (z.B. Powershell) ist von Vorteil
 * Kenntnisse im Arbeiten mit Datenbanken, insbesondere SQL
 * Kenntnisse im Bereich der Virtualisierung (z.B. Microsoft Hyper-V)
 * Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Microsoft Betriebssystemen und Komponenten
 * Fundiertes Wissen über Testingverfahren, -methoden und –werkzeuge sowie deren Einsatz in agilen Teams
 * Idealerweise praktische Erfahrungen im Einsatz von BDD mit Cucumber
 * Kenntnisse in SW-Entwicklungsumgebungen (z.B. Microsoft Visual Studio / TFS, Eclipse) sind wünschenswert
 * Erfahrung mit Automated Mobile Testing ist von Vorteil
 * ISTQB Zertifizierungen sind von Vorteil
 * Gute Erfahrungen in der Analyse, Design und Entwicklung von komplexen Tests

Außerdem sind bei uns Kreativität und Flexibilität bei der Lösungsfindung willkommen!

Was wir bieten


 * Bei uns findest du Kolleg:innen, mit denen die Zusammenarbeit Spaß macht. Wir begegnen uns offen, duzen uns über alle Positionen hinweg und denken nicht in Hierarchien oder Silos.
 * Du arbeitest meist direkt an deinem Heimatort – weil wir Kundennähe wörtlich nehmen und uns Work-Life-Balance am Herzen liegt.
 * Du profitierst von flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und hast je nach Kundensituation die Möglichkeit, von zuhause zu arbeiten.
 * Wir bieten verschiedene Modelle, damit du mobil sein kannst: Firmenwagen oder Dienstfahrrad.
 * Die richtigen Trainings und Zertifikate bringen deine Weiterbildung voran. Unsere E-Learning-Plattform Academia ermöglicht dir das Lernen, wo und wann du willst.
 * Einen Teil deines Bruttogehalts kannst du in CGI-Aktien investieren – bis maximal 3 % des Monatsgehalts geben wir für jeden Euro einen weiteren hinzu.
 * Außerdem beteiligen wir dich am Unternehmenserfolg: Du erhältst eine Gewinnbeteiligung, die sich nach Deiner individuellen Leistung richtet, sowie danach, wie wir als Unternehmen unsere finanziellen Ziele erreichen konnten.
 * Wir sind an deiner Seite, auch wenn es einmal nicht so gut läuft: Du kannst Sonderurlaub nehmen, und unsere Beratungshotline steht dir immer zur Verfügung.
 * Eine Vielzahl an gemeinsamen Events und Freizeitaktivitäten stärkt Deine Verbundenheit mit deinen Kolleg:innen.
   
   

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

1976 gegründet und nach wie vor familiengeführt, ist CGI heute einer der weltweit größten unabhängigen Anbieter von IT und Business Consulting. Ein hohes Maß an Eigenverantwortung, Teamwork, Respekt und Zusammenhalt machen das Arbeiten bei uns besonders. Bei uns kannst du dein volles Potenzial entfalten!

Du darfst dich vom ersten Tag an als Miteigentümer:in von CGI verstehen. Wir lassen unsere Vision gemeinsam Wirklichkeit werden. Wir profitieren von unserem gemeinsamen Erfolg und haben die Möglichkeit und die Verantwortung, die Strategie und Ausrichtung unseres Unternehmens aktiv mitzugestalten.

Deine Arbeit schafft Mehrwert. Du findest innovative Lösungen und stärkst dein Netzwerk aus Kolleg:innen und Kunden. Gleichzeitig hast du Zugang zu globalen Ressourcen, um große Ideen zu verwirklichen, neue Chancen zu nutzen und von der immensen Branchen- und Technologie-Kompetenz zu profitieren.

Du bringst deine Karriere voran, da du in einem Unternehmen arbeitest, das auf Wachstum und Langlebigkeit ausgelegt ist. Du wirst von Führungskräften unterstützt, die deine Gesundheit und Zufriedenheit fördern – und dir Möglichkeiten bieten, deine Fähigkeiten zu vertiefen und deinen Horizont zu erweitern.

title: Software tester (m/f/d)
description:
As a software tester (m/f/d), you ensure the quality and stability of our CRM broker software. Your job is as varied as our SaaS. From the creation of the requirements specification to the final implementation of features, projects and customizations, you will accompany the entire development process.

QA / Software Testing / ISTQB / Bug Tracking / Manual Testing / Automated Testing / Test Automation / Regression Testing / Creation of functional specifications

Your advantages


 * Job quality - We organize ourselves according to the Kanban principle. Structured processes and a focus on precision ensure the quality of our software.
 * Good salary - We offer you an attractive, competitive salary that reflects your experience and performance.
 * Work-life balance - Flexitime, 29 vacation days plus company vacations on Christmas and New Year's Eve, home office arrangement and our shared desk help you to organize your working hours flexibly.
 * Onboarding - you start in Support to get to know the software. This is followed by individual training with your personal mentor.
 * Prospects - We support your professional qualification with individual further training measures and modern tools, such as ISTQB certification.
 * Collaboration - You will work closely with developers, product managers and the QA team to agree priorities and find solutions together.
 * Team culture - Look forward to lots of experiences: Team events, our team trip or time together after work.
   
   

Your tasks


 * Test adaptations to our software - from small improvements to complex functions or new modules.
 * Check identified bugs, ensure quality in every release and document them in detail in the bug tracking system
 * Test new features and functions, e.g. the synchronization of property listings with various portals
 * Work closely with software developers and product managers and accompany the implementation from the creation of the specifications to acceptance and presentation in the online help.
 * Plan your own projects and contribute your ideas to further perfect and automate our test processes.
   
   

Your profile


 * Experience as a software tester or developer or as a career changer with an interest in sophisticated software concepts.
 * Knowledge in quality assurance of SaaS software and ideally also in testing Android and iOS apps.
 * Basic knowledge of HTML or a programming language is helpful.
 * You enjoy working in a team and know how to communicate test results clearly and precisely.
 * Very good knowledge of German (at least C1) and good knowledge of English.
   
   

onOffice - Always on your side

More than 6,000 brokers and 35,000 users in Europe use onOffice enterprise every day to manage business processes and marketing. Our aim is maximum stability and security. The Quality Assurance Team contributes to the sustainable success of our customers.

This is your team: Software Development & Operation ( https://onoffice.com/ueber-uns/team-software-development-operation /)

title: Software Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
Die timeghost GmbH ist ein innovatives und hochmodernes Unternehmen mit Start-up Flair aus Konstanz am Bodensee. 

Wir entwickeln auf höchstem Niveau Softwarelösungen für Office 365 und Microsoft Teams. Wer bei uns arbeitet entwickelt sich kontinuierlich weiter und arbeitet in einem tollen Team, mit spannenden Lösungen und Projekten. 

Du suchst das passende Unternehmen, indem du dich weiterentwickeln und Eigeninitiative zeigen kannst? Dann werden auch du Teil unseres Teams! 

 

Welche Aufgaben erwarten Dich?

 

 1. Planung und Entwicklung von Testfällen:  

 * Analyse von Anforderungen und Erstellung passender Testpläne. 
 * Entwurf von Testfällen für Funktionstests, Regressionstests und End-to-End-Tests. 

2. Durchführung von Tests: 

 * Manuelles und automatisiertes Testen von Software, APIs und Systemen. 
 * Identifikation, Dokumentation und Verfolgung von Fehlern im Bug-Tracking System. 

3. Automatisierung: 

 * Entwicklung und Wartung von Testautomatisierungsskripten mit Tools wie Selenium, Cypress, oder JUnit. 

4. Berichterstattung:  

 * Erstellen von Testberichten und Dokumentation der Testergebnisse.  
 * Kommunikation von Risiken und Qualitätsproblemen an das Team und das Management. 

5. Sicherstellung der Benutzerfreundlichkeit: 

 * Durchführung von Usability-Tests und Feedback-Analysen aus der Benutzerperspektive. 

 

Welche Qualifikationen bringst Du mit? 

Fachlich 

 * Erfahrung: Mindestens 2 Jahre Erfahrung im Software-Testing oder in der Qualitätssicherung 
 * Kenntnisse: 
 * Testmethoden und Teststrategien  
 * Erfahrung mit Testmanagement-Tools (Azure DevOps, etc.) 
 * Kenntnisse in einer Programmiersprache (z. B. Python, Java, C#) 
 * Verständnis von agilen Methoden wie Scrum oder Kanban 
 * Erfahrung mit CI/CD-Tools wie Jenkins, GitLab oder Azure DevOps 
 * Erfahrung mit Virtual Machines, networking protocols und HTTP 
 * Vertraut mir Logs & Metrics 
 * Erfahrung mit SQL  

 

Soft Skills: 

 * Analytisches Denken: Fähigkeit, komplexe Probleme zu identifizieren und strukturiert zu lösen. 
 * Kommunikationsfähigkeit: Klare und präzise Kommunikation von Testergebnissen und technischen Details. 

 

Details: 

 * Teamfähigkeit: Zusammenarbeit mit Entwicklern, Designern und Produktmanagern. 
 * Detailorientierung: Fokus auf Qualität und Genauigkeit. 

 

Was bieten wir Dir? 

 * “Startup”-Atmosphäre mit viel Freiheit, Individualität und offener Kommunikation über alle Ebenen 
 * Interessante und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit 
 * Sicherer, familienfreundlicher und anspruchsvoller Arbeitsplatz in einem zukunftsorientierten Unternehmen 
 * Sehr gute Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten 
 * Moderne Büroräume direkt am See 
 * Mitgestaltung im Unternehmen 
 * Viele verschiedene Mitarbeiterbenefits 

 

Wenn Du ein/e leidenschaftliche(r) Testingenieur/in – Software Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer bist, die/der gerne mit der neuesten Technik arbeitet, werde Teil unseres herausragenden und agilen Entwicklerteams und schicke uns deine Bewerbungsunterlagen. 

 

Bewirb Dich per Mail unter: personal@timeghost.io

title: Junior Test Engineer Graduate (d/f/m)
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth, and an international and innovative environment! This is creating many opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference.

At Cognizant, together with colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate to create solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, innovative and successful. This is your chance to join the success story driven by our Quality Engineering and Assurance (QE&A) Team. We’re looking for a

Junior Test Engineer Graduate (d/f/m)

Location: Frankfurt am Main, Germany (hybrid)

Program start date: January 2025

Your Key Responsibilities

As a Junior Test Engineer Graduate (d/f/m) in QE&A, you will work closely with customers in the different industries to define and refine their quality requirements. You’ll work in a team of onsite and offshore associates to create and maintain manual and automated tests, often invoked “lights out”. You’ll help to identify the most critical business processes and create tests to expose any deviation from expected behavior. You will need to identify selected test scenarios that can be automated and for use in regression testing. The team you work in will investigate test failures and manage defects to track their correction. And you’ll regularly report on the completeness of test coverage and status of test results.

Primary Skills And Experience Required


 * Minimum a bachelor’s degree in relevant field (e.g. Informatics, Engineering, etc.)
 * Graduation completed in the last 2 years
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills (C1) in German and English
 * Able to work independently, identify/mitigate risk, estimate effort for testing.
 * Familiar with many types of tests, such as functional, interface, middleware, system integration, user-acceptance, regression and non-functional
 * Familiar with modern methodologies such as Agile and V-model
   
   

Secondary Skills And Experience (Nice To Have)


 * Working Knowledge in test and defect management tools like JIRA or ALM
 * Familiar with concepts of test automation.
   
   

What You Can Expect


 * A comprehensive graduate program with graduates from all over Europe, providing everything to set up your career for success
 * A permanent contract right from the start
 * Competitive compensation which includes paid healthcare
 * The possibility to be involved in client projects in other industries
 * Competent guidance by an advisor and a mentor assigned during your graduate journey
 * Educational trainings for enhancing your consulting, technology and soft skills that enable you to grow to your full potential
 * The opportunity to make an impact on societies globally
 * The chance to contribute on shaping the future of world-leading organizations

Dentsply Sirona’s products provide innovative, high-quality and effective solutions to advance patient care and deliver better and safer dentistry. Dentsply Sirona’s global headquarters is located in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA. The company’s shares are listed in the United States on NASDAQ under the symbol XRAY.




Bringing out the best in people




As advanced as dentistry is today, we are dedicated to making it even better. Our people have a passion for innovation and are committed to applying it to improve dental care. We live and breathe high performance, working as one global team, bringing out the best in each other for the benefit of dental patients, and the professionals who serve them. If you want to grow and develop as a part of a team that is shaping an industry, then we’re looking for the best to join us.




Working at Dentsply Sirona you are able to:




Develop faster - with our commitment to the best professional development.




Perform better - as part of a high-performance, empowering culture.




Shape an industry - with a market leader that continues to drive innovation.




Make a difference -by helping improve oral health worldwide.




Test Automation Engineer (m/f/d) - Bensheim, Germany




We are looking for a qualified Software Engineer with experience or a strong interest in developing expertise in test automation. As a Test Automation Engineer (m/f/d) you will be responsible for designing and implementing automated testing solutions in the highly interesting domain of cloud-based software for dental healthcare. You will work in a team that embraces modern tools and workflows to achieve high-quality software and fast release cycles.







Your Responsibilities:




 * Develop test automation solutions written in Golang, based on the Gherkin/Cucumber framework
 * Develop solutions for automating the end-2-end testing of our software applications, including backend and frontend components written in Golang and Dart/Flutter
 * Integrate the test execution and reporting to the CI/CD pipeline
 * Develop interfaces to our issue tracking and monitoring services
 * Support the teams in increasing the requirements and code coverage of automated testing
 * Improve the reporting of automated test results and their inclusion to product documentation
 * Share your work results and test automation knowledge with the teams of our software organization, for example, in stakeholder demos and learning days
 * Contribute your own ideas in our agile development process







Your Profile:




 * BS or MS in computer science or related engineering disciplines
 * Years and Type of Experience:
 * 5+ years as a DevOps Engineer, Software Engineer, or comparable role
 * Experience in developing of commercially successful software
 * Key Skills, Knowledge & Capabilities:
 * Experience in writing software, preferably in C++ and/or Golang
 * Experience in writing software tests, good understanding of software testing concepts (for example: TDD, BDD, testing pyramid)
 * Experience in frontend development, preferably with Dart/Flutter, TypeScript, or JavaScript is an advantage
 * Experience with the Gherkin/Cucumber framework or other test frameworks is an advantage
 * Solid knowledge of DevOps and agile development methodologies
 * Knowledge in CI/CD, containerization and cloud computing
 * Strong problem-solving skills
 * Strong commitment to deliver high-quality results
 * High motivation to learn and apply modern technology
 * Strong communication skills
 * Very good knowledge of English
 * Occasional travel to one of our other software development sites is part of this role

title: Software-Tester (m/w/d) für Frontend und End-to-End Testing
description:
Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir in Vollzeit einen engagierten Software-Tester (m/w/d) mit Fokus auf Frontend, Anwendungen und End-to-End Testing zwischen verschiedenen Systemen wie ERP, Webshop oder CRM. Wir arbeiten mit agilen Methoden wie Scrum oder Kanban und nutzen Tools wie JIRA oder Azure DevOps für unser Projektmanagement.




Deine Vorteile bei Prediger

 * Wir möchten, dass du dich wohlfühlst: Wir bieten dir einen abwechslungsreichen Job in einem dynamischen Unternehmen und du kannst dich auf ein gutes Arbeitsklima freuen.
 * Wir fördern dich: Du erhältst eine umfassende Einarbeitung, kannst dich intern und extern weiterbilden, wenn du möchtest, und hast Raum für persönliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung.
 * Wir schaffen den Spagat zwischen Selbstständigkeit und Teamwork: Kurze Entscheidungswege und flache Hierarchien bieten dir den Freiraum, den du brauchst. Trotzdem sind deine Kollegen und deine Vorgesetzten immer für dich da, wenn du Hilfe benötigst.
 * Wir bieten familienfreundliche Arbeitszeiten und übernehmen für dich dein Deutschlandticket. Zudem kannst du auf Wochen-Basis bis zu 40% deiner Arbeitszeit im Home-Office arbeiten.
 * Wir planen mit dir eine gemeinsame Zukunft: Du bekommst eine sichere und langfristige Anstellung.




Deine Aufgaben

 * Planung und Durchführung von Tests: Erstellen und Ausführen von Feature-Testfällen für unsere Frontend-Anwendungen und Backend-Systemen wie ERP und CRM
 * Durchführung von Regressionstests: Weiterentwicklung und Durchführung der Regressionstests (manuell oder automatisiert).
 * Testautomatisierung: Entwicklung und Pflege von automatisierten End-to-End Tests mit geeigneten Tools (z. B. Selenium, Cypress).
 * Integrations- und Schnittstellentests: Testen der Datenflüsse und Funktionalitäten zwischen verbundenen Systemen zur Sicherstellung einer nahtlosen Integration.
 * Agiles Arbeiten: Mitarbeit in Teams, die nach Scrum oder Kanban arbeiten, und Nutzung von JIRA oder Azure DevOps für das Aufgaben- und Projektmanagement.
 * Fehleranalyse: Identifizieren, Dokumentieren und Nachverfolgen von Softwarefehlern, insbesondere in Bezug auf die Systemkommunikation und Datenkonsistenz.
 * Zusammenarbeit im Team: Enger Austausch mit Entwicklern, Produktmanagern und anderen Stakeholdern zur Sicherstellung der Softwarequalität über alle Systeme hinweg.
 * Qualitätssicherung: Mitwirkung bei der kontinuierlichen Verbesserung unserer Testprozesse und -methoden, speziell im Bereich der Systemintegration. Entwicklung und Umsetzung einer Deployment-Strategie mit Quality Gates über die Systemgrenzen hinweg.




Dein Profil

 * Ausbildung: ISTQB Certified Tester oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
 * Erfahrung: Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Software-Testing
 * Fachkenntnisse:
 * Gute Kenntnisse in Testautomatisierungswerkzeugen und -frameworks.
 * Erfahrung mit ERP-, Webshop- oder CRM-Systemen.
 * Praxis in agilen Methoden wie Scrum oder Kanban.
 * Vertrautheit mit JIRA oder Azure DevOps.
 * Programmierkenntnisse: Erfahrung mit JavaScript, Java, Python, HTML und CSS sind von Vorteil.
 * Arbeitsweise: Analytisches Denken, sorgfältige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise.
 * Soft Skills: Teamfähigkeit, Kommunikationsstärke und hohe Eigenmotivation.
 * Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, sowie gute Englischkenntnisse.




Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!




Bitte beachte: Ein Lebenslauf und ein Anschreiben sind erforderlich. Nutze dafür die Funktion zum Hochladen mehrerer Dateien in der Bewerbung.

title: Senior Test Engineer
description:
Join Our Innovative Team!




Are you ready to elevate your career in a dynamic environment where your expertise in instrumentation and control (I&C) will make a real impact? At our cutting-edge laboratories, you’ll play a crucial role in ensuring the highest standards of quality, safety, and reliability in automation technology.




What You’ll Do




Test and Evaluation:

 * Take charge of the entire testing process—from preparation and implementation to thorough documentation and follow-up on examinations.
 * Innovate by developing test methods, tools, and setups tailored to regulatory, normative, and customer-specific needs.
 * Ensure the integrity of our testing by reviewing results for validity and reliability in accordance with DIN EN ISO/IEC 17025.
 * Dive deep into data interpretation and create detailed test reports that showcase your findings.




Documentation and Consulting:

 * Share your expertise by documenting and disclosing test methods and processes.
 * Be a trusted advisor to customers, guiding them through their orders with confidence.




Development and Maintenance:

 * Unleash your creativity by designing and developing state-of-the-art test equipment and systems.
 * Take ownership of adjusting and verifying test equipment, and perform essential maintenance on complex devices.




What You Bring to the Table




Your Qualifications:

 * Completed technical vocational training plus two years of specialized training as a state-certified technician, or a degree in electrical engineering (or equivalent qualifications).
 * Experience in the development, manufacturing, or testing of measuring instruments (think oscilloscopes, bipolar voltage testers, insulation monitoring devices).
 * A wealth of professional experience paired with in-depth specialist knowledge.
 * Experience and understanding of the following standards; 61557 - 8, 61243 or 61010 – 1




Your Skills:

 * Strong written and spoken English skills.
 * A proactive, independent approach with a knack for systematic prioritization.
 * Excellent communication skills, coupled with a team-oriented mindset.
 * A willingness to take on responsibility and drive projects forward.




What We Offer You

 * Indefinite Employment Contract: Secure your future with us.
 * Competitive Salary: Enjoy an attractive salary aligned with the collective agreement for the metal and electrical industry in Hesse, complete with holiday and Christmas bonuses and additional benefits.
 * Flexible Work Environment: Benefit from a well-developed infrastructure, flexible working hours, and the option for mobile work.
 * Professional Growth: We’re committed to your development with ongoing training and exciting opportunities for advancement within our organization.

title: Flight Test Instrumentation Engineer  (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

You will be a member of our flight test team, planning and conducting both manned and unmanned flight test campaigns and continuing to build up the Flight Test Organization. Tests will usually be conducted locally but may involve campaigns at remote locations from time to time. You will work closely with our team to design, integrate and operate the Instrumentation System to help with the flight test campaign of our new aircraft.


 * Provide planning for the system design and installation in conformity with the company strategy.
 * Conceptual and detailed design of the integration of various FTI components that combined will act together as a system.
 * Ensure adherence to flight safety analysis and DOA design handbook – the design has a direct impact on the safety of flight (SOF).
 * Build and test the system, both air and ground segment to ensure high reliability and greater dispatchability of the test vehicle.
 * Lead the FTI flight operations as assigned, coordinating a team of FTITech on the field and operate the ground station ensuring data and comms to the crew.
 * Supply chain management to ensure parts are provided in accordance with the flight test plan.
 * Propose & implement instrumentation solutions for ground tests on test aircraft as off aircraft (radio receiving signals for voice and data, as well as the management of significant amount of software for data processing and pos-test data sharing)
 * Design and agree with different engineering teams how to incorporate large and complex system in the flight test vehicle.
 * Provide input to Project Management and Test Engineering Lead on project performance against established milestones
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor’s or Master degree in Aerospace, Electrical Engineering or a comparable degree
 * 7+ years of experience as FTIE involved in aircraft development & certification process.
 * Experience in contributing to building up a Flight Test Organization, structure working processes (design rules handbooks, installation instructions)
 * Very good understanding of electrical, electronics to mechanics and structures
 * Problem solving skills
 * Business fluent in English. Other languages like German would be a plus
 * Extensive flexible mobility in order to support FTI operations on aircraft, being deployed with the test aircraft at multiple test locations
   
   

Preferred skills:


 * Experience in Sensor/Wiring installation
 * Experience with CAD/Schematic drawings tools
 * Basic programming skills, like Python
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: Laboratory Test Engineer - Avionics (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Job Description

Your crew during this flight:

We are a growing team in the Laboratory Testing department and are responsible for testing the various systems integration of our eVTOL vehicle in the laboratory environment.

Our mission is to ensure that systems’ functional and certification requirements are verified, and by strong interaction with system designers and developers, show that the systems are airworthy.

Your mission during this flight:

To ensure efficiency in the test execution you will support the development, installation, and operation of the laboratory as well as its integration with the aircraft systems.


 * You will ensure test procedures and test cases validation, traceability, and proper documentation

 * You will be deeply involved in identifying and documenting test results and, if applicable, deviations
 * You will be deeply involved in issues or deviations troubleshooting
 * It will be your duty to set up, configure and validate the test equipment before each test execution
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor’s /Master´sdegree in engineering or similar degree or experience, Aerospace Engineering will be considered as a plus
 * 5+ years of working experience working experience with systems test benches or laboratories
 * 5+ years of working experience of Aircraft Avionics systems
 * 3+ years of working experience with Requirements Engineering
 * Knowledge of system schematics and wiring diagrams
 * Very good knowledge of the English language
 * Structured, independent, and solution-oriented way of working
 * Experience communicating effectively with internal and external stakeholders
   
   

Preferred skills:


 * Software development knowledge (Python)

title: Flight Test Specialist Engineer - Structures (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

You will be a member of our Flight Test Team, providing technical and operational expertise in Structures & Dynamics, for ground and flight tests of crewed and uncrewed configurations. Tests will usually be conducted locally, (Bruchsal/Lahr) but may involve campaigns at remote locations from time to time.

You will work closely with our engineering and structural rig testing teams to assist our flight testing process and to ensure the required readiness for test in time, on cost and quality. In addition, you will manage activities related to the aircraft DMU. As a Senior FTSE, you will be a mentor to more junior engineers, and have opportunities for technical guidance. Volocopter has an established Flight Test Organization as part of our EASA Part21J Design Organization Approval (DOA).


 * You will be involved with planning, monitoring, and optimizing Ground and Flight Test activities for electric aircraft development and certification purposes on your specialities (Structures) for the overall functions of a complete aircraft
 * You will assist with aircraft preparation, inspection, and repair pre/post-test (in particular on composite structures)
 * You will take care of aircraft snags and findings as well as the implementation of aircraft configuration changes required for specific flight test campaign, including liaising with design engineering, production and maintenance when required
 * You will support flight test operation as telemetry crew for structures-related topic
 * You will be involved in the assessment and documentation of tests including troubleshooting and development of standardized analysis and reporting tools
 * You will work on engineering projects, the solution of which requires technological advances and related development
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * 10+ years of experience as an Engineer involved in aeronautical development and certification process
 * Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent technical education
 * Experience in metallic and composite structures from design and maintenance/repair perspective
 * Experience in planning, monitoring and analysing envelope expansions, dynamics, loads, vibro-acoustics and flutter tests
 * Experience in designing (using CAD programs such as Siemens NX or equivalent), analysis for structural strength assessment
 * Experience in using telemetry software (such as Curtiss-Wright IADS or equivalent) for GUI development and monitoring real-time critical parameters during flight test operations
 * Communicative team player, well organized with a proven ability to get things done
 * Knowledge of the English language at a professional level
   
   

Preferred skills:


 * Education or experience in rotorcraft flight testing
 * Aircraft MRO experience
 * Experience as an MRB/Liaison Engineer
   
   

Additional Information

Our Volocopter flight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity at Volocopter:

Our differences are what make us great. Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential.

title: Associate Software Engineer
description:
Everyone is welcome at Handshake. We know diverse teams build better products and we are committed to creating an inclusive culture built on a foundation of respect for all individuals. We strongly encourage candidates from non-traditional backgrounds, historically marginalized or underrepresented groups to apply.

Your impact

We Are Bringing Handshake’s Mission To Europe, And We Want You To Join Our Growing Development Team To Help Democratize Opportunities For Students Globally! As a Core Member Of Our Engineering Team, You Will


 * Build scalable and efficient software solutions that empower students to kickstart their careers.
 * Collaborate with senior engineers to learn and implement best practices in software engineering.
 * Support feature development and bug fixes across various parts of the application stack, directly enhancing the student job-seeking experience.
 * Participate in the full software development lifecycle, including design, implementation, testing, and deployment, ensuring seamless functionality for our users.
 * Assist in maintaining system reliability by addressing technical issues and implementing enhancements that improve platform performance.
 * Contribute to team documentation and knowledge sharing, fostering collaboration and project success.
   
   

You are

We value diverse perspectives and experiences. Whether you’re a recent graduate or transitioning to a software development career, we’d love to hear from you if you share our passion for building impactful software.


 * A recent graduate or early-career software engineer with 0-1 year of experience in professional software development.
 * Passionate about building software and eager to learn modern development practices.
 * Curious, self-motivated, and excited to solve real-world problems using technology.
 * A strong communicator with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
 * Able to adapt quickly to new tools, frameworks, and technologies.
 * Proactive in seeking guidance and feedback to improve your technical skills.
 * Detail-oriented with a focus on writing clean, well-documented code.
   
   

Technical Skills We’re Looking For

We’re excited about what you already know and eager to help you learn more. You’ll thrive in this role if you have:


 * Strong foundational understanding of programming concepts and software development principles.
 * Basic knowledge of networking and system design concepts.
 * Familiarity with one or more programming languages (e.g., Ruby, Python, Golang, JavaScript, TypeScript).
 * Basic understanding of web technologies (HTML, CSS, REST APIs).
 * Willingness to learn modern frameworks (e.g., RoR, React).
 * Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD pipelines.
 * Exposure to databases and basic query writing skills.
   
   

Growth Path

As An Associate Software Engineer, You'll


 * 0-4 months: Familiarize yourself with the codebase, tools, and development workflows. Work on small, well-defined tasks such as bug fixes and minor feature updates. Collaborate closely with team members to learn best practices and deploy your first updates to production.
 * 4-8 months: Take on medium-sized tasks and contribute to feature development under the guidance of senior engineers. Develop a deeper understanding of the application stack, participate actively in design discussions and code reviews, and work cross-functionally with design or product teams.
 * 8-12 months: Own a small feature from start to finish, including design, implementation, and testing. Demonstrate increasing independence while continuing to seek feedback and mentorship. Build proficiency in debugging and addressing system reliability issues.
 * Beyond: Gradually take the lead on initiatives, from project scoping to implementation, and tackle more complex technical challenges as you grow into a Software Engineer role.
   
   

We are committed to your development and will provide mentorship, training, and opportunities to advance your career.

If you’re passionate about technology, eager to grow, and excited about building impactful software, we’d love to hear from you!

For cash compensation, we set standard ranges for all U.S.-based roles based on function, level, and geographic location, benchmarked against similar stage growth companies. In order to be compliant with local legislation, as well as to provide greater transparency to candidates, we share salary ranges on all job postings regardless of desired hiring location. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors, including geographic location as well as candidate experience and expertise, and may vary from the amounts listed above.

About Us

Handshake is the career platform for Gen Z. With a community of over 17 million students, alumni, employers, and career educators, Handshake’s network is where career advice and discovery turn into first, second, and third jobs. Nearly 1 million companies use Handshake to build their future workforce—from Fortune 500 to federal agencies, school districts to startups, healthcare systems to small businesses. Handshake is built for where you’re going, not where you’ve been.

When it comes to our workforce strategy, we’ve thought deeply about how work-life should look at Handshake. With our hybrid-work model, employees benefit from collaboration and shared team experiences three days per week in our vibrant offices, and enjoy the flexibility of remote work two days per week. Handshake is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in New York, London, and Berlin.

What we offer

At Handshake, we'll give you the tools to feel healthy, happy and secure.

Benefits Below Apply To Employees In Full-time Positions.


 * 💰 Equity and ownership in a fast-growing company.
 * 🍼 16 Weeks of paid parental leave for birth giving parents & 10 weeks of paid parental leave for non-birth giving parents.
 * 💝 Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision policies including LGTBQ+ Coverage. We also provide resources for Mental Health Assistance, Employee Assistance Programs and counseling support.
 * 💻 Handshake offers $500/£360 home office stipend for you to spend during your first 3 months to create a productive and comfortable workspace at home.
 * 📚 Generous learning & development opportunities and an annual $2,000/£1,500/€1,850 stipend for you to grow your skills and career.
 * 💰 Financial coaching through Origin to help you through your financial journey.
 * 🛜 Monthly internet stipend and a brand new MacBook to allow you to do your best work.
 * 🚃 Monthly commuter stipend for you to expense your travel to the office (for office-based employees).
 * 🥗 Free lunch provided twice a week across all offices.
 * 🤝 Referral bonus to reward you when you bring great talent to Handshake.
   
   

(US-specific Benefits, In Addition To The First Section)


 * 🏦 401k Match: Handshake offers a dollar-for-dollar match on 1% of deferred salary, up to a maximum of $1,200 per year.
 * 🏝 All full-time US-based Handshakers are eligible for our flexible time off policy to get out and see the world. In addition, we offer 8 standardized holidays, and 2 additional days of flexible holiday time off. Lastly, we have a Winter #ShakeBreak, a one-week period of Collective Time Off.
 * 🍼 Family support: We partner with Milk Stork to provide comprehensive 100% employer-sponsored lactation support to traveling parents and guardians. Parental leave coaching and support provided by Parentaly.
   
   

(UK-specific Benefits, In Addition To The First Section)


 * 🏦 Pension Scheme: Handshake will provide you with a workplace pension, where you will make contributions based on 5% of your salary. Handshake will pay the equivalent of 3% towards your pension plan, subject to qualifying earnings limits.
 * 🏝 Up to 25 days of vacation to encourage people to reset, recharge, and refresh, in addition to 8 bank holidays throughout the year.
 * 🤝 Regular offsites each year to bring the team together + opportunity to travel to our HQ in San Francisco.
 * 🛍️ Discounts across various high street retailers, cinemas and other social activities exclusively for Handshake UK employees.
   
   

(Germany-specific Benefits, In Addition To The First Section)


 * 🏝 25 days of annual leave + 5 days of a winter #ShakeBreak, a one-week period of Collective Time Off across the company.
 * 🤝 Regular offsites each year to bring the team together + opportunity to travel to our HQ in San Francisco once a year.
 * 🧘 Urban sports club membership offering access to a diverse network of fitness and wellness facilities.
 * 🛍️ Discounts across various high street retailers, cinemas and other social activities exclusively for Handshake Germany employees.
   
   

Looking for more? Explore our mission, values and comprehensive US benefits at joinhandshake.com/careers.

If you need assistance or reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at people-hr@joinhandshake.com.

title: Software Engineer in Test
description:
At Dataiku, we're not just adapting to the AI revolution, we're leading it. Since our beginning in Paris in 2013, we've been pioneering the future of AI with a platform that makes data actionable and accessible. With over 1,000 teammates across 25 countries and backed by a renowned set of investors, we're the architects of Everyday AI, enabling data experts and domain experts to work together to build AI into their daily operations, from advanced analytics to Generative AI.

Why Engineering at Dataiku?

Dataiku’s on-premise, cloud, or SaaS-deployed platform connects many data science technologies, and our technology stack reflects our commitment to quality and innovation. We integrate the best of data and AI tech, selecting tools that truly enhance our product. From the latest LLMs to our dedication to open source communities, you'll work with a dynamic range of technologies and contribute to the collective knowledge of global tech innovators. You can find out even more about working in Engineering at Dataiku by taking a look here.

How You’ll Make An Impact

This position is either onsite from Paris, London, Berlin and Amsterdam or remote from these countries.

As a Software Developer Engineer in Test (SDET), your mission will be to ensure that we only deliver highest-quality products to our customers. You will play a crucial role in our success by helping our users have the best possible experience.

Dataiku's platform is built on modern Web technologies (single page webapp with Angular/AngularJS) and integrates with a very large ecosystem of big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, MPP databases, Cloud services, ...).

Our software testing stack is based on Python, Pytest, Selenium, and Allure for the integration tests. Our CI is based on Jenkins with intensive usage of AWS’s features.

At Dataiku, developers are involved in writing part of the automated integration tests together with the QA team.

Here's a taste of how you can help the team:


 * Coding advanced automated test suites to exercise our applications at all levels
 * Defining manual testing plans, test strategies and define priorities
 * Working with the developers to ensure that they deliver testable code
 * Improving existing test infrastructure and frameworks (virtual machines, containers, auto-provisioning, UI testing, ...)
 * Mentoring and helping new QA team members
   
   

What You Need To Be Successful


 * You have experience in software test engineering with a significant part in automation (API and/or UI Testing)
 * You think collaborating with developers is the key for a good testing strategy
 * You have worked with at least one Object Oriented language (such as Python, Java, C#, or C++)
 * You discuss choices before implementing them
   
   

What Will Make You Stand Out


 * Experience with big data technologies, such as Hadoop, Spark, or Kubernetes
 * Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, and GCP
 * Basic knowledge of Machine Learning
   
   

What does the hiring process look like?


 * Initial call with a member of our Technical Recruiting team
 * Peer interview with two members of the team
 * A take-home test to show your skills
 * Debrief of your technical test with the VP of Test Engineering
 * Final Interview with a VP of Engineering
   
   

What are you waiting for!

At Dataiku, you'll be part of a journey to shape the ever-evolving world of AI. We're not just building a product; we're crafting the future of AI. If you're ready to make a significant impact in a company that values innovation, collaboration, and your personal growth, we can't wait to welcome you to Dataiku! And if you’d like to learn even more about working here, you can visit our Dataiku LinkedIn page.

Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity, decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please contact us at: reasonable-accommodations@dataiku.com

title: Senior Quality Assurance Automation Engineer f/m/d
description:
Incari is an international technology and software company revolutionizing the human-machine interface (HMI) landscape. Through our state-of-the-art technologies, we enable various companies to turn HMI systems from concept into reality. Our platform simplifies the process of HMI development, enabling designers and engineers to collaborate and build HMIs quickly, efficiently, and cost-effectively. Our commitment to a 3D-first approach and low-code makes tech development more accessible than ever before.

Our mission is to deliver exceptional software that meets the highest standards of quality. We are looking for a detail-oriented and proactive Senior QA Engineer who will play a vital role in our development team, helping to ensure that our software is built with quality and accuracy. You will assist in shaping our testing workflows, from unit testing to overall system evaluation, improving our overall development process. You will also be required to develop and implement test strategies and pipelines for large-scale and embedded software systems with a good understanding of python and hands-on experience in testing large-scale applications with python. Familiarity with the latest industry tools for setting up automated testing pipelines is a must.

Requirements


 * 7+ years professional automation experience in system application testing
 * Proven experience working on complex software systems
 * Writing automation tests and plans in python and familiarity with modern testing frameworks and tools.
 * Strong understanding of software development processes and CI/CD workflows.
 * Proficiency in Python for test automation, knowledge of C++ and QT is a plus
 * Exceptional attention to detail
 * Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
 * Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
 * Ability to work independently and proactively in a fast-paced environment.
 * Great team player and able to work efficiently with minimal supervision
 * Living in Berlin with the relevant documentation
   
   
   

Responsibilities:


 * Develop, implement, and maintain comprehensive test plans and test cases for our software products to ensure the software meets requirements
 * Perform functional, regression, integration, and performance testing.
 * Design and implement automated test scripts and frameworks using Python.
 * Develop and maintain and optimize testing pipelines, improving efficiency and effectiveness of testing
 * Work closely with development teams to understand technical requirements and ensure seamless quality integration.
 * Act as a quality advocate, identifying potential risks and areas for improvement.
 * Identify, report, and track software bugs with clear documentation.
 * Work with developers to reproduce and resolve issues efficiently.
 * Mentor junior QA engineers and share best practices with the team.
   
   
   

Benefits


 * Up to 30 days annual leave
 * Agile start-up mentality in an established company
 * Being part of a diverse and multicultural team
 * Flat hierarchies, team spirit, and curious mindset
 * Bike benefit
 * Hybrid work environment
 * Opportunities for career growth and professional development
 * A fun and inclusive work culture, where creativity and innovation are celebrated
